result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob E Laurishke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy-Pub Place/Person Present, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.   Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

No contact with victims: M.R.S. (dob: 9/14/1992) and M.L.O. (dob: 1/30/1996) or UW-Waukesha Campus.
Prohibited from possessing of any device capable of taking pictures and/or videos except as authorized by his Agent.
Must allow his Agent to have unlimited access to any instrument capable.
DNA Sample to be provided.
Given the defendant's diagnosis of autism, the court requests that the Department of Corrections carefully consider the nature of treatment needed.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob E Laurishke

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jacob E Laurishke in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  
Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney LaVoy makes statements to the court on behalf of his client.
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Defendant was given the following as to Count 1:

WITHHELD SENTENCE (CREDIT - 1 day if revoked);

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No contact with: Victims: M.R.S. (dob 09/14/92) and M.L.O. (dob 01/30/96), or UW-Waukesha campus 
*Prohibited from possessing of any device capable of taking pictures and/or videos except as authorized by his agent.
*Must allow his agent to have unlimited access to any instrument capable
*DNA sample to be provided.

Given the defendant's diagnosis of autism, the Court requests that the Department of Corrections carefully consider the nature of treatment needed.  

COURT COSTS:  $243 (cash bail to be applied);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200 (cash bail to be applied);

Appeal rights given.
